author: brad.decker
content: I'm sure this has been asked a million times already but is there a definitive resource for the current thinking regarding what eth_gasPrice will do after the fork and is eth_feeHistory and doing our own math on the returned object the most correct way of doing estimations at this juncture?

author: sky.cactus
content: eth_gasPrice will continue to give estimates appropriate for legacy transactions.

author: brad.decker
content: in metamask we delete the gasPrice parameter before calling estimateGas, so that we don't get a balance failure error and instead just get an estimate to use for gasLimit for the tx. I am seeing in the Transaction shape in the JSON rpc spec repo that a transaction could have "oneOf" the EIP-1559 fields (both required), or gasPrice (not required).

author: brad.decker
content: is it fine for us to strip all gas fields and submit without gasPrice or the new EIP-1559 fields (effectively estimating gasLimit the same)
